summary: Crypto trading monitoring application where users manually input trading positions and receive AI-powered take-profit and stop-loss recommendations based on technical analysis
architectural_notes: Frontend calls Binance Futures API directly for market data
Technical analysis algorithms for TP/SL recommendations (support/resistance, SMC, FVG, ATR)
Leverage is independent from investment amount; total exposure = investment × leverage
Real-time price updates with visual indicators for TP/SL zones
PWA implementation with service worker for offline capabilities
AI-powered market sentiment analysis from external data sources
Risk management calculator with portfolio-level exposure tracking
known_issues: PWA installation via beforeinstallprompt not working reliably; user requests a direct download/install button to force the process
AI trades hitting TP1/TP2/TP3 are not executing fictitious orders or advancing risk management steps (e.g., moving SL to breakeven after TP1)
Settings/API key gear icon button in the header is unresponsive when clicked — the BinanceCredentialsPanel settings section does not open
Enabling 'Live Trade Mode' causes the application to freeze/hang — the only recovery is closing the app; orders are not being sent to Binance
'Import from Binance' button not visible in Dashboard tab even when Binance credentials are configured and connection test passes

existing_features.title: Create a manual position entry form with fields for asset selection (dropdown/autocomplete validated against Binance USD-M Futures perpetual pairs), position type (Long/Short selector), leverage (1x to 125x numeric input), entry price (numeric input), and investment amount in USD (numeric input). Calculate and prominently display total exposure as investment × leverage.

Fetch and display the list of valid Binance USD-M Futures perpetual pairs from the Binance Futures API (https://fapi.binance.com/fapi/v1/exchangeInfo) in the frontend. Filter to show only perpetual contracts (contractType: 'PERPETUAL'). Handle API errors with clear user messages.

Implement real-time position monitoring that fetches current prices from Binance Futures API (https://fapi.binance.com/fapi/v1/ticker/price) in the frontend. Calculate and display current PnL in both USD and percentage, distance to TP/SL levels, and real exposure versus investment amount. Update prices automatically at regular intervals.

Generate AI-powered take-profit recommendations with three levels (TP1, TP2, TP3) based on technical analysis concepts including support/resistance levels, Smart Money Concepts (SMC), Fair Value Gaps (FVG), asset volatility, and leverage used. For each TP level, display the target price, profit in USD, and profit percentage. Show technical reasoning and market structure analysis supporting the recommendations.

Calculate recommended stop-loss levels that consider leverage risk (tighter SL for higher leverage), ATR (Average True Range) for volatility assessment, and percentage of capital at risk. Display the SL price, potential loss in USD and percentage, and explain the risk management logic. Suggest partial profit-taking strategies with specific instructions.

Create a position dashboard that displays all monitored positions in a list/table format with real-time price updates. Include visual indicators (colors, badges, or highlights) when positions approach TP or SL zones. Use color coding to show profit (green) and loss (red) status. Persist all positions to localStorage so they survive page refreshes.

Implement technical analysis algorithms in the frontend for intelligent TP/SL recommendations. Include calculations for support/resistance identification, volatility metrics (ATR), and risk-reward ratios. Ensure algorithms adapt recommendations based on position parameters (leverage, position type, asset volatility).

Design a clean, modern UI with Tailwind CSS that presents trading data clearly with appropriate visual hierarchy. Use cards or panels to organize position information, recommendations, and monitoring data. Ensure the interface supports real-time updates without flickering or layout shifts.

Update the color scheme throughout the application to use golden/gold tones as the primary accent color, replacing the current color palette while maintaining good contrast and readability for both light and dark modes
Add background graphics and chart visualizations to create a modern technological aesthetic, using subtle patterns or wallpaper-like elements that don't interfere with content readability
Update the Tailwind CSS configuration and CSS variables to incorporate the golden color scheme, ensuring all UI components (buttons, badges, cards, alerts) automatically adopt the new theme

Create a service worker configuration file that enables offline functionality by caching static assets (HTML, CSS, JS, images) and API responses with a cache-first strategy for static resources and network-first strategy for Binance API calls

Create a web app manifest file (manifest.json) with application metadata including name 'Crypto Position Monitor', short_name, description, theme_color using the golden color scheme, background_color, display mode set to 'standalone', start_url, and icons in multiple sizes (192x192, 512x512) for optimal display across devices

Add a prominent 'Install App' button in the application header that detects PWA installation capability using the beforeinstallprompt event, shows only when installation is available, triggers the browser's native installation prompt when clicked, and hides automatically after successful installation

Configure the application to work in standalone mode by updating meta tags for mobile web app capabilities (apple-mobile-web-app-capable, mobile-web-app-capable), setting appropriate viewport configuration, and ensuring the UI adapts properly when running as an installed PWA without browser chrome

Register the service worker in the main application entry point with proper error handling, update detection, and lifecycle management to ensure the PWA functionality activates correctly on all supported browsers

Implement market sentiment analysis that aggregates sentiment indicators from multiple sources and displays a sentiment score (bullish/bearish/neutral) with visual gauge or indicator for each traded asset. Include sentiment strength percentage and brief explanation of contributing factors.

Create trend prediction feature using technical indicators and pattern recognition that analyzes recent price action, volume, and momentum to predict short-term and medium-term trend direction. Display prediction confidence level, expected price movement direction (up/down/sideways), and time horizon for each prediction.

Implement automatic TP/SL adjustment suggestions that continuously monitor market conditions (volatility changes, support/resistance breaks, momentum shifts) and recommend real-time adjustments to existing position targets. Display adjustment recommendations as actionable cards showing current vs. suggested TP/SL levels with reasoning for each change.

Create position size calculator that takes user's total capital, risk percentage per trade (1-10%), and stop-loss distance to calculate optimal position size and investment amount. Display recommended position size in USD, number of contracts, actual risk amount in USD, and risk-reward ratio. Include visual slider for risk percentage adjustment.

Implement total portfolio exposure visualization that aggregates all active positions to show total capital at risk, total potential profit, portfolio-wide leverage exposure, and correlation risk between positions. Display as dashboard widget with visual charts showing exposure breakdown by asset, position type (long/short balance), and risk concentration.

Create scenario simulator tool that allows users to input hypothetical price movements (as percentage changes) for their positions and see projected P&L outcomes. Display results showing total portfolio impact, individual position outcomes, margin requirements at simulated prices, and potential liquidation warnings. Include quick scenario presets like 'Market crash -20%', 'Bull run +30%', 'High volatility ±15%'.

Design and integrate AI and risk management features into the existing golden-themed UI using consistent styling with Tailwind CSS. Create new dashboard sections or tabs for AI insights (sentiment, predictions, adjustment suggestions) and risk management tools (calculator, exposure, simulator). Ensure all new components follow the established visual hierarchy with cards, appropriate spacing, and responsive layouts that work on mobile and desktop.

Create a persistent total capital input field in the frontend that allows users to enter and save their total available trading capital in USD. This value must be stored in localStorage and persist across browser sessions and page refreshes.

Update the Position Size Calculator component to use the stored total capital value automatically instead of requiring manual capital input each time. Pre-populate the capital field with the saved total capital value and allow users to override it for specific calculations if needed.

Enhance the Portfolio Exposure Dashboard to calculate and display real risk metrics based on the user's total capital. Show the percentage of total capital at risk across all active positions, the percentage of capital deployed, and remaining available capital. Add visual warnings when risk exceeds recommended thresholds (e.g., >50% capital deployed, >10% total capital at risk).

Update the Scenario Simulator to incorporate the user's total capital when calculating portfolio impact. Display scenario results as percentages of total capital in addition to absolute USD values. Show clear warnings when simulated scenarios would result in significant capital loss (e.g., >20% of total capital).

Add a prominent total capital summary card or widget to the main dashboard that displays the user's total capital, currently deployed capital, capital at risk, and available capital. Include a quick-edit button that allows users to update their total capital without navigating away from the dashboard.

Create a persistent total capital storage utility in the frontend that saves and retrieves the user's total available trading capital (in USD) using localStorage with the key 'total_capital'. Include functions to get, set, and validate the stored value.

Create a TotalCapitalInput component that displays an input field for the user's total trading capital with validation (positive numbers only), a save button, and visual feedback on save success. Load the initial value from localStorage on mount.

Add a prominent Total Capital Summary card to the main dashboard (in App.tsx) that displays the user's total capital, currently deployed capital (sum of all position investments), capital at risk (sum of all potential losses to stop-loss), and available capital (total minus deployed). Include a quick-edit icon/button that opens the TotalCapitalInput inline or in a modal.

Update the PositionSizeCalculator component to automatically pre-populate the capital input field with the stored total capital value from localStorage. Allow users to override this value for specific calculations, but do not persist the override.

Enhance the PortfolioExposureDashboard component to calculate and display real risk metrics as percentages of the user's total capital: percentage of capital deployed, percentage of capital at risk, and percentage of available capital. Add visual warning badges or alerts when deployed capital exceeds 50% or capital at risk exceeds 10% of total capital.

Update the ScenarioSimulator component to incorporate the user's total capital when displaying scenario results. Show the total portfolio impact as both absolute USD values and as a percentage of total capital. Display prominent warnings when any scenario would result in a loss exceeding 20% of total capital.

Use the generated wolf/crypto logo image (app-logo.dim_512x512.png) as the application logo in the app header. Display it in the top navigation/header area of the app, sized appropriately (e.g., 40x40px or 48x48px). Also update the PWA manifest icons to reference this logo image and update the apple-touch-icon and favicon references in index.html to use the same logo file.

Replace or supplement the existing PWA install button (InstallButton.tsx) with a always-visible 'Download App' button in the app header that does not depend on the beforeinstallprompt event. When clicked, it should trigger a direct download of the PWA as a web app by: (1) still attempting the native browser install prompt if available via the existing usePWAInstall hook, and (2) as a fallback, showing a modal or tooltip with clear step-by-step instructions for manually installing the app on Chrome (Add to Home Screen via browser menu), Safari (Share → Add to Home Screen), and other major browsers. The button must always be visible regardless of browser install prompt availability.

Create a new 'AI Daily Trades' section/page in the frontend that showcases one simulated AI trade per trading modality. The supported modalities must include: Scalping (very short-term, minutes), Day Trading (intraday), Swing Trading (multi-day), and Trend Following (longer-term). Each trade entry must display: the asset symbol (Binance USDT-M Futures perpetual), position type (Long/Short), entry price, current price (fetched live from https://fapi.binance.com/fapi/v1/ticker/price), leverage used, investment amount, current PnL in USD and percentage, TP1/TP2/TP3 levels, stop-loss level, trade status (Open/Closed/TP Hit/SL Hit), and the timestamp when the trade was initiated (daily reset each UTC day).

Implement an AI trade selection algorithm in the frontend that automatically picks one asset and determines entry direction (Long/Short), leverage, and investment amount for each trading modality once per UTC day. The algorithm must use real Binance kline data (https://fapi.binance.com/fapi/v1/klines) to compute technical indicators (trend direction, RSI, ATR, momentum) appropriate to each modality's timeframe: Scalping uses 1m/5m klines, Day Trading uses 15m/1h klines, Swing Trading uses 4h/1d klines, Trend Following uses 1d/1w klines. The selected trades and their parameters must be persisted in localStorage under the key 'ai_daily_trades' and reset/regenerated once per UTC day (when the stored date differs from today's UTC date).

Create a visual AI Daily Trades dashboard UI that renders each modality's trade as a styled card consistent with the existing golden-themed design. Each card must include: a modality badge/label (e.g., 'Scalping', 'Day Trading', 'Swing Trading', 'Trend Following'), a color-coded PnL indicator (green for profit, red for loss), TP level progress indicators showing how close the current price is to each TP level, an SL proximity warning when price is within 10% of the stop-loss, a brief AI reasoning summary explaining why the asset and direction were chosen (based on the technical indicators computed during trade selection), and a 'Last updated' timestamp. Display a daily performance summary header showing total AI portfolio PnL across all four trades.

Refactor the main App.tsx layout to use a tab-based navigation system with four tabs: 'Dashboard', 'AI Daily Trades', 'AI Insights', and 'Risk Management'. The header (logo, Install/Download App button) must remain visible at all times above the tab bar. Only the content of the active tab should be rendered (or kept mounted but hidden) to avoid layout shifts.

Move the Dashboard tab content to include: the TotalCapitalSummary card, the PositionEntryForm, and the PositionDashboard (active positions list with real-time PnL). This tab should be the default active tab on app load.

Move the AI Daily Trades content (AIDailyTradesSection component and its AIDailyTradesSummary header) into the 'AI Daily Trades' tab. This tab should display the daily performance summary banner and the four modality trade cards (Scalping, Day Trading, Swing Trading, Trend Following).

Create an 'AI Insights' tab that consolidates all per-position AI analysis features: SentimentGauge, TrendPredictionCard, and AdjustmentSuggestionCard components. Group these by active position, showing the symbol as a section heading. If no positions exist, display an empty-state message prompting the user to add a position from the Dashboard tab.

Create a 'Risk Management' tab that contains the PositionSizeCalculator, PortfolioExposureDashboard, and ScenarioSimulator components. Arrange them in a logical vertical or grid layout consistent with the golden-themed card design.

Update the AI trade monitoring logic (useAITradeMonitoring.ts and/or useAITradeGeneration.ts) so that when any AI trade's status transitions to 'TP Hit' or 'SL Hit', a new AI trade for that same modality is automatically generated and replaces the closed trade — without waiting for the daily UTC reset or requiring the user to click 'Regenerate today's trades'. The new trade must be selected using the same AI trade selection algorithm (technical indicators, kline data) already used for daily generation, and the updated trade list must be persisted to localStorage under the key 'ai_daily_trades'.

Update the AI trade selection algorithm (frontend/src/utils/aiTradeSelection.ts) and the useAITradeGeneration hook so that the investment amount assigned to each AI daily trade is derived from the user's stored total capital (retrieved via totalCapitalStorage). Distribute the capital proportionally across the four modalities (e.g., 25% each, or a configurable split). If no total capital is stored, fall back to a sensible default (e.g., $1,000 per trade). Regenerate trades automatically when the total capital value changes.

Create a Performance Comparison panel component (PerformanceComparisonPanel.tsx) that displays AI trades vs user manual positions side by side. For AI trades, aggregate: total trades closed (TP Hit + SL Hit), win rate percentage, total PnL in USD, and breakdown by modality (Scalping, Day Trading, Swing Trading, Trend Following). For user positions, aggregate: total positions closed (those with a recorded outcome in localStorage), win rate percentage, and total PnL in USD. Display both sets of metrics in a visually comparable card layout consistent with the golden-themed design.

Track user position outcomes in localStorage. When a user's manual position is deleted from the PositionDashboard, prompt the user to record the outcome (TP Hit, SL Hit, or Manually Closed) and the exit price. Store this history in localStorage under the key 'user_trade_history' as an array of closed trade records (symbol, position type, entry price, exit price, investment, PnL USD, PnL %, outcome, timestamp). This history will feed the PerformanceComparisonPanel win rate and PnL calculations.

Integrate the PerformanceComparisonPanel into the 'AI Daily Trades' tab (AIDailyTradesTab.tsx), placing it below the existing AIDailyTradesSection. The panel should always be visible in that tab, showing live stats from both AI trade history and user trade history stored in localStorage.

Implement fictitious order execution logic for AI trades when a TP level is reached. When the live price crosses TP1, mark TP1 as 'Executed' and automatically move the stop-loss to the trade's entry price (breakeven). When TP2 is reached and TP1 has already been executed, mark TP2 as 'Executed' and move the stop-loss to TP1 price (trailing stop). When TP3 is reached and TP2 has already been executed, mark TP3 as 'Executed' and close the trade with full TP3 profit recorded in AI trade history. Persist the updated trade state (executed TP levels, adjusted SL) in localStorage under the key 'ai_daily_trades'.

Update the AITradeCard component to visually reflect the fictitious order execution state. For each TP level, display a status badge indicating whether it is 'Pending', 'Executed', or 'Missed' (price passed without execution). Show the current effective stop-loss price with a label indicating whether it is the original SL, 'Breakeven (Entry)', or 'Trailing (TP1)' depending on which TP levels have been executed. Display a timeline or step indicator showing the trade's progression through TP1 → Move SL to Entry → TP2 → Trail SL to TP1 → TP3 → Close.

Extend the AITrade TypeScript type (frontend/src/types/aiTrade.ts) to support partial TP execution state. Add fields: 'tp1Executed' (boolean), 'tp2Executed' (boolean), 'tp3Executed' (boolean), 'effectiveSL' (number — the current active stop-loss price after any trailing adjustments), and 'riskManagementStep' (enum or string: 'initial' | 'breakeven' | 'trailing' | 'closed'). Ensure these fields are optional with sensible defaults for backward compatibility with existing stored trades.

Implement a market reversal detection algorithm in the frontend (frontend/src/utils/marketReversalDetector.ts) that analyzes recent Binance kline data to identify potential trend reversals. The algorithm must evaluate: momentum divergence (RSI divergence from price action), EMA crossover signals (short-term EMA crossing long-term EMA in the opposite direction of the trade), significant candlestick reversal patterns (engulfing candles, shooting stars, hammers), ATR-based volatility spikes that signal structural breaks, and support/resistance zone violations. The function must accept the current AITrade parameters (symbol, position type, entry price, effective SL, current price, TP execution state) and return a ReversalSignal object containing: detectedReversal (boolean), confidence (0–100), reason (string description), recommendedAction ('close' | 'reverse' | 'tighten_sl' | 'none'), and suggestedNewSL (number, optional).

Extend the AITrade TypeScript type (frontend/src/types/aiTrade.ts) to include reversal detection state fields: 'reversalDetected' (boolean), 'reversalConfidence' (number 0–100), 'reversalReason' (string), 'reversalAction' (string: 'close' | 'reverse' | 'tighten_sl' | 'none'), and 'profitProtectionSL' (number — the tightened stop-loss price set by reversal protection logic). All fields must be optional with sensible defaults (reversalDetected: false, reversalConfidence: 0, reversalAction: 'none') for backward compatibility with existing stored trades.

Integrate the market reversal detection algorithm into the useAITradeMonitoring hook (frontend/src/hooks/useAITradeMonitoring.ts). On each price polling cycle, for every open AI trade with status 'Open', run detectReversal from marketReversalDetector.ts. Based on the returned ReversalSignal: (1) If recommendedAction is 'close' — immediately set trade status to 'SL Hit' (closed by reversal protection), record the exit at current price in AI trade history with a note 'Closed by reversal detection', and trigger auto-regeneration for that modality. (2) If recommendedAction is 'reverse' and the trade has passed TP1 (tp1Executed is true) — close the current trade at current price with profit recorded, then queue a new trade for that modality in the opposite direction. (3) If recommendedAction is 'tighten_sl' — update the trade's effectiveSL to the suggestedNewSL value and set profitProtectionSL accordingly, and persist to localStorage. Update the stored trade in localStorage under 'ai_daily_trades' after each action.

Update the AITradeCard component (frontend/src/components/AITradeCard.tsx) to visually display the reversal detection state. When reversalDetected is true, show a prominent amber/orange warning banner inside the card with the reversalReason text and a badge indicating the action taken (e.g., 'Reversal Detected — SL Tightened', 'Reversal Detected — Trade Closed', 'Reversal Detected — Direction Reversed'). When reversalAction is 'tighten_sl', display the profitProtectionSL price alongside the effectiveSL with a label 'Profit Protection SL'. When a trade was closed by reversal detection, show a distinct status badge 'Closed — Reversal Guard' in addition to the normal closed state. The reversal warning must use the existing golden-themed design system (amber/orange tones from the existing CSS variables) and not introduce new color tokens.

Add a 'Reversal Guard' summary metric to the AIDailyTradesSummary component (frontend/src/components/AIDailyTradesSummary.tsx) that counts how many trades were protected (closed or reversed) by the reversal detection algorithm today. Display this as a small stat alongside the existing PnL summary (e.g., 'Reversal Guards: 2') so users can see how many times the AI protected profits during the day.

Create a BinanceCredentials settings panel component (frontend/src/components/BinanceCredentialsPanel.tsx) that allows users to input and save their Binance Futures API Key and Secret. Store both values in localStorage under the keys 'binance_api_key' and 'binance_api_secret'. Display a masked input for the Secret field (password type). Include a 'Save Credentials' button with success/error feedback, a 'Clear Credentials' button to remove stored keys, and a warning notice that keys are stored locally in the browser and never sent to any server. Add a connection test button that calls the Binance Futures account endpoint (https://fapi.binance.com/fapi/v2/account) with the stored credentials to verify they are valid, and show a clear 'Connected' or 'Invalid credentials' status badge.

Create a frontend utility module (frontend/src/utils/binanceAuth.ts) that implements HMAC-SHA256 request signing for the Binance Futures authenticated API. The module must expose: (1) a 'signQuery' function that accepts a query parameter string and the API Secret, appends a 'timestamp' parameter, and returns the full signed query string including the computed HMAC-SHA256 'signature' parameter; (2) a 'getStoredCredentials' function that retrieves 'binance_api_key' and 'binance_api_secret' from localStorage; (3) a 'hasCredentials' function that returns true only if both keys are present and non-empty; and (4) an 'authenticatedFetch' helper that builds a signed request, attaches the 'X-MBX-APIKEY' header, and returns the parsed JSON response or throws a typed BinanceApiError.

Create a frontend service module (frontend/src/services/binanceOrderService.ts) that uses the binanceAuth utility to place real orders on Binance USD-M Futures (https://fapi.binance.com/fapi/v1/order). Expose the following functions: (1) 'placeMarketOrder(symbol, side, quantity)' — places a MARKET order; (2) 'placeLimitOrder(symbol, side, quantity, price)' — places a LIMIT order with timeInForce GTC; (3) 'placeStopMarketOrder(symbol, side, quantity, stopPrice)' — places a STOP_MARKET order; (4) 'placeTakeProfitMarketOrder(symbol, side, quantity, stopPrice)' — places a TAKE_PROFIT_MARKET order; (5) 'cancelOrder(symbol, orderId)' — cancels an existing order; and (6) 'getOpenOrders(symbol)' — retrieves open orders for a symbol. All functions must call authenticatedFetch from binanceAuth.ts. If credentials are missing, throw a descriptive error instead of making the network call.

Add a 'Live Trading' mode toggle to the application. Store the toggle state in localStorage under the key 'live_trading_enabled'. When Live Trading mode is OFF (default), the existing fictitious/simulated order logic continues unchanged. When Live Trading mode is ON and valid Binance credentials are stored, actual order calls via binanceOrderService.ts are made when: (a) a new position is added — place a market entry order and set TP/SL orders (TAKE_PROFIT_MARKET and STOP_MARKET); (b) an AI trade is triggered — place the corresponding entry and TP/SL orders on Binance Futures. Display a clearly visible amber badge or banner in the header when Live Trading mode is active to prevent accidental real trades.

Integrate the BinanceCredentialsPanel and the Live Trading toggle into the existing UI. Add a 'Settings' section accessible from the app header (e.g., a gear icon button). Inside the Settings section, render the BinanceCredentialsPanel and the Live Trading mode toggle. The Settings section must be consistent with the existing golden-themed card design. Also add a small credential status indicator (e.g., 'API Connected' or 'No API Key') visible in the app header at all times, so the user can immediately see whether their Binance credentials are configured.

Fix the Settings gear icon button in the app header (App.tsx) so that clicking it reliably opens the SettingsDialog modal. Investigate and resolve the broken click handler — ensure the button's onClick is correctly wired to the dialog's open state, that no z-index, pointer-events, or event-propagation issues are blocking the interaction, and that the SettingsDialog renders and is visible when triggered.

Fix the Live Trading mode toggle in LiveTradingToggle.tsx and useLiveTradingMode.ts so that enabling it does not cause the application to freeze or become unresponsive. The freeze likely originates from a synchronous blocking operation, an infinite re-render loop triggered by state changes when live trading is activated, or an unhandled promise rejection in the order placement flow that locks the UI. Audit the toggle activation path — including the confirmation dialog, credential validation, localStorage write, and any reactive effects that fire on live trading state change — and ensure all async operations are non-blocking with proper error boundaries.

Fix the order execution flow in usePositionStorage.ts, useAITradeGeneration.ts, and binanceOrderService.ts so that when Live Trading mode is ON and valid Binance credentials are present, real orders are actually sent to Binance Futures (https://fapi.binance.com/fapi/v1/order). Ensure all order calls (market entry, TAKE_PROFIT_MARKET, STOP_MARKET) are properly awaited, errors are caught per-order without aborting the entire flow, and the result (success or failure) is surfaced to the user via a toast notification. If an order fails, log the error and continue — do not let a single order failure block position creation or AI trade activation.

Audit all useEffect and React Query hooks that listen to the live trading mode state (live_trading_enabled in localStorage) — including useLiveTradingMode.ts, usePositionStorage.ts, and useAITradeGeneration.ts — and remove or fix any dependency array entries or event listener registrations that could cause infinite loops or cascading re-renders when live trading is toggled. Ensure custom window event listeners for live trading state changes are registered once and properly cleaned up on unmount.

Remove the daily UTC reset logic from the useAITradeGeneration hook (frontend/src/hooks/useAITradeGeneration.ts) and useAITradeStorage hook (frontend/src/hooks/useAITradeStorage.ts). Trades stored under the key 'ai_daily_trades' in localStorage must no longer be invalidated or regenerated based on a UTC date comparison. The stored date field should be removed or ignored. Trades must persist indefinitely until they are individually closed (TP Hit, SL Hit, or Reversal Guard) and replaced by the auto-regeneration logic already in place.

Create a frontend service function in frontend/src/services/binanceOrderService.ts (or a dedicated frontend/src/services/binancePositionService.ts) that fetches the user's currently open positions from the Binance USD-M Futures account endpoint (https://fapi.binance.com/fapi/v2/positionRisk or https://fapi.binance.com/fapi/v2/account) using the authenticatedFetch utility from binanceAuth.ts. Filter results to include only positions where positionAmt is non-zero. Map each Binance position response to the app's internal Position type (symbol, positionType as Long/Short based on positionAmt sign, entryPrice, leverage, investment derived from positionAmt × entryPrice / leverage). If credentials are missing or the API call fails, throw a descriptive typed error.

Add an 'Import from Binance' button to the Dashboard tab (DashboardTab.tsx), visible only when Binance credentials are configured (use hasCredentials from binanceAuth.ts). When clicked, the button calls the Binance open positions service function from REQ-68, then merges the returned positions into the existing positions list managed by usePositionStorage — skipping any position whose symbol is already tracked to avoid duplicates. Display a loading spinner on the button while the fetch is in progress. On success, show a toast notification indicating how many positions were imported (e.g., 'Imported 3 positions from Binance'). On failure, show a toast with the error message.

Fix the 'Import from Binance' button visibility logic in DashboardTab.tsx so that the button reliably appears whenever Binance credentials are present in localStorage (i.e., hasCredentials() from binanceAuth.ts returns true). The current implementation fails to show the button even when credentials are correctly saved and the connection test passes. Audit the following: (1) ensure the component re-evaluates hasCredentials() reactively — not just on initial mount — by listening for the custom credential-change DOM event (dispatched by liveTradingStorage.ts or binanceAuth.ts when credentials are saved); (2) ensure the conditional rendering check is not blocked by any additional state flag (e.g., live trading mode, connection test result) beyond the presence of credentials; (3) verify the component re-renders after credentials are saved from the SettingsDialog without requiring a full page reload. The button must become visible immediately after the user saves valid credentials in the Settings panel, without requiring a page refresh.

In useLiveTradingMode.ts, increase the credential validation timeout when enabling Live Trading mode. The current validation call to the Binance Futures account endpoint (https://fapi.binance.com/fapi/v2/account) must use an AbortController with a timeout of at least 15 seconds (up from any shorter default). If the validation request does not complete within the timeout, treat it as a non-blocking warning (log the timeout, show a toast 'Credential check timed out — Live Trading enabled without verification') and still allow the toggle to activate. Do not block or reject the Live Trading activation solely due to a slow or non-responsive network request.

In BinanceCredentialsPanel.tsx, increase the timeout for the 'Test Connection' button's fetch call to the Binance Futures account endpoint (https://fapi.binance.com/fapi/v2/account) to at least 15 seconds using AbortController. If the request exceeds the timeout, display a clear status message: 'Connection test timed out — server did not respond in time. Your credentials may still be valid.' Do not leave the UI in a loading/frozen state after a timeout.

In binanceAuth.ts, add a default request timeout of 15 seconds to the authenticatedFetch helper using AbortController. If the caller provides its own signal, merge both signals so that either the caller's abort or the 15-second timeout will cancel the request. On timeout, throw a typed BinanceApiError with code 'REQUEST_TIMEOUT' and a descriptive message. This ensures all authenticated Binance API calls across the app (order placement, position import, credential test) time out cleanly instead of hanging indefinitely.

In LiveTradingToggle.tsx, wrap the entire toggle activation flow (confirmation dialog → credential validation → localStorage write → state update) in a try/catch/finally block. Ensure the component never remains in a permanent loading or disabled state after any error or timeout. If any step in the activation flow throws or times out, reset the toggle UI to its previous state (OFF) and display a toast with the specific error message. Add a maximum total activation timeout of 20 seconds: if the entire activation flow does not complete within 20 seconds, automatically reset the toggle to OFF and show 'Live Trading activation timed out — please try again'.

In usePositionStorage.ts and useAITradeGeneration.ts, wrap all calls to binanceOrderService functions (placeMarketOrder, placeTakeProfitMarketOrder, placeStopMarketOrder) in individual try/catch blocks with a per-call timeout of 10 seconds enforced via AbortController (passed as a signal option if supported, or via a Promise.race with a timeout promise). If any single order call times out or fails, log the error to console, show a toast notification (e.g., 'Entry order timed out — position saved locally only'), and continue execution without blocking position creation or AI trade activation. The position or AI trade must be saved to localStorage regardless of whether the Binance order calls succeed.

Rewrite the SettingsDialog open/close state management in App.tsx to use a simple local useState hook (e.g., `const [settingsOpen, setSettingsOpen] = React.useState(false)`). Wire the gear icon button's onClick directly to `() => setSettingsOpen(true)` with no intermediate handlers, wrappers, or conditions. Ensure the SettingsDialog receives `open={settingsOpen}` and `onOpenChange={setSettingsOpen}`. Remove any z-index, pointer-events, or overflow CSS that could intercept clicks on the gear button. Verify the dialog renders and is dismissible in all four tabs.

Completely refactor the Live Trading activation flow in LiveTradingToggle.tsx and useLiveTradingMode.ts to be fully non-blocking: (1) Remove any synchronous credential validation that runs on the React render thread. (2) Move credential validation into an async function guarded by a 15-second AbortController timeout. (3) Wrap the entire activation sequence (confirmation → validation → localStorage write → state update) in a single try/catch/finally with a 20-second outer race timeout using `Promise.race`. (4) In the `finally` block, always clear the loading/pending state so the toggle never stays stuck. (5) If validation times out, still activate Live Trading and show a toast: 'Credential check timed out — Live Trading enabled without verification'. (6) If any step throws, reset the toggle to OFF and display the specific error in a toast. (7) Ensure the confirmation dialog does not block the React event loop — use state-driven rendering, not `window.confirm`.

Audit and fix all useEffect hooks and window event listeners in useLiveTradingMode.ts, usePositionStorage.ts, and useAITradeGeneration.ts that respond to the 'live_trading_enabled' localStorage key or any custom DOM events related to live trading. (1) Ensure each event listener is registered exactly once using an empty or stable dependency array. (2) Every addEventListener call must have a corresponding removeEventListener in the useEffect cleanup function. (3) Remove any state setters or refs from useEffect dependency arrays that would cause the effect to re-register on every render. (4) Confirm that toggling Live Trading on or off does not trigger cascading re-renders or re-mounts of unrelated components.

Fix the order execution flow in usePositionStorage.ts and useAITradeGeneration.ts so that real Binance orders are sent when Live Trading mode is active. (1) Each call to placeMarketOrder, placeTakeProfitMarketOrder, and placeStopMarketOrder must be individually wrapped in its own try/catch block. (2) Enforce a 10-second per-call timeout using Promise.race with a timeout promise. (3) On timeout or error, log to console and show a specific toast (e.g., 'Entry order timed out — position saved locally only') then continue execution. (4) Position creation and AI trade activation must complete and persist to localStorage regardless of whether any individual Binance order call fails. (5) On success, show a toast confirming the order was placed (e.g., 'Entry order placed on Binance').

Fix the authenticatedFetch helper in frontend/src/utils/binanceAuth.ts to reliably apply the 15-second timeout. (1) Create an internal AbortController with a 15-second timeout using setTimeout. (2) If the caller passes an external signal, combine both using a new AbortController that aborts when either the caller's signal fires or the 15-second timer fires. (3) Always clear the internal timeout in a finally block after the fetch resolves or rejects. (4) On timeout, throw a BinanceApiError with code 'REQUEST_TIMEOUT' and message 'Request timed out after 15 seconds'. (5) Ensure this timeout applies uniformly to all callers: BinanceCredentialsPanel test button, useLiveTradingMode validation, binanceOrderService order placement, and binancePositionService position import.

Fix the 'Import from Binance' button visibility in DashboardTab.tsx so it reactively appears as soon as credentials are saved. (1) Replace the static initial evaluation of hasCredentials() with a useState that is updated by listening to the 'credential-change' custom DOM event dispatched by liveTradingStorage.ts or binanceAuth.ts. (2) Register the event listener once in a useEffect with an empty dependency array, and remove it on cleanup. (3) The button must be visible solely based on hasCredentials() returning true — remove any additional guards such as live trading mode or connection test status from the visibility condition. (4) Dispatch the 'credential-change' event from BinanceCredentialsPanel.tsx immediately after saving credentials to localStorage so DashboardTab.tsx re-evaluates without a page reload.

Fix the 'Test Connection' button in BinanceCredentialsPanel.tsx to never leave the UI in a frozen or perpetual loading state. (1) Wrap the fetch in a try/catch/finally block where the finally block always resets the loading state. (2) Apply a 15-second AbortController timeout to the fetch call. (3) If the timeout fires, display the status message: 'Connection test timed out — server did not respond in time. Your credentials may still be valid.' and clear the loading state. (4) Ensure the button is re-enabled after timeout, error, or success so the user can retry.

Ensure the CredentialStatusIndicator component in the app header stays in sync with credential state changes without requiring a page reload. (1) Subscribe to the 'credential-change' custom DOM event in a useEffect with an empty dependency array. (2) On each event, re-evaluate hasCredentials() and isLiveTradingEnabled() and update local state. (3) Also subscribe to the 'live-trading-change' event to update the live trading indicator. (4) Clean up all event listeners on unmount. (5) The indicator must update within the same render cycle as the credential save or live trading toggle.

Perform a comprehensive audit of all components and hooks that use localStorage reads at the module or component initialization level (outside of useEffect or event handlers) and replace them with reactive patterns. Specifically: (1) Any call to hasCredentials(), isLiveTradingEnabled(), or getTotalCapital() that runs only once on mount must be moved inside a useState initializer combined with a useEffect that subscribes to the relevant custom DOM events ('credential-change', 'live-trading-change'). (2) Ensure the LiveTradingBanner component also subscribes reactively to the 'live-trading-change' event so it appears/disappears without a reload. (3) Document each fixed location with a comment indicating the event it listens to.

Extend the AITrade TypeScript type (frontend/src/types/aiTrade.ts) to include an optional boolean field 'liveOrdersEnabled' that controls whether real Binance orders are sent for that specific modality. Default the field to false for backward compatibility with existing stored trades.

Add a localStorage utility function to frontend/src/utils/liveTradingStorage.ts (or a dedicated utility) that reads and writes per-modality live order settings under the key 'modality_live_orders' as a JSON object keyed by modality name (e.g., { 'Scalping': true, 'Day Trading': false, 'Swing Trading': false, 'Trend Following': false }). Expose getModalityLiveOrders(), setModalityLiveOrder(modality, enabled), and dispatch a custom DOM event 'modality-live-orders-change' after every write so dependent components update reactively.

Add a toggle switch (labeled 'Send orders to Binance') to each AITradeCard component (frontend/src/components/AITradeCard.tsx), one per modality card. The switch must: (1) read its initial state from getModalityLiveOrders() for the card's modality; (2) reactively update when the 'modality-live-orders-change' DOM event fires; (3) call setModalityLiveOrder(modality, newValue) when toggled; (4) be disabled and show a tooltip 'Enable Live Trading globally first' when the global live trading mode is OFF (isLiveTradingEnabled() returns false); (5) be fully functional (enabled/disabled independently per modality) when global live trading mode is ON. Style the toggle consistently with the existing golden-themed design.

Update the order placement logic in useAITradeGeneration.ts and useAITradeMonitoring.ts so that real Binance orders (entry, TAKE_PROFIT_MARKET, STOP_MARKET) are only sent for an AI trade when BOTH conditions are true: (1) global live trading mode is ON (isLiveTradingEnabled() returns true) AND (2) the per-modality live orders setting is ON for that trade's modality (getModalityLiveOrders()[trade.modality] === true). If either condition is false, skip order placement and continue with the local/simulated flow as before.

Update the PositionSizeCalculator component (frontend/src/components/PositionSizeCalculator.tsx) to fetch and use the live current price from the Binance Futures API (https://fapi.binance.com/fapi/v1/ticker/price?symbol=SYMBOL) for the selected asset when calculating position size. Display the live price next to the entry price field as a reference. Also fetch and display the leverage brackets/tiers for the selected symbol from https://fapi.binance.com/fapi/v1/leverageBracket?symbol=SYMBOL (public endpoint, no auth required) to show the maximum allowed leverage and the corresponding maintenance margin rate at the selected leverage level. Warn the user if their chosen leverage exceeds the maximum allowed for the selected symbol.

Update the PortfolioExposureDashboard component (frontend/src/components/PortfolioExposureDashboard.tsx) and its underlying usePortfolioExposure hook (frontend/src/hooks/usePortfolioExposure.ts) to enrich each position with its live current price fetched from the Binance Futures ticker API (https://fapi.binance.com/fapi/v1/ticker/price). Use the live prices to calculate real-time unrealized PnL per position, real current exposure (quantity × current price), and distance to liquidation price. Display these live-price-based metrics in the dashboard cards, clearly distinguishing between entry-price-based and current-price-based exposure values. Refresh live prices every 30 seconds.

Update the ScenarioSimulator component (frontend/src/components/ScenarioSimulator.tsx) and its underlying scenarioSimulator utility (frontend/src/utils/scenarioSimulator.ts) to use live current prices from the Binance Futures ticker API (https://fapi.binance.com/fapi/v1/ticker/price) as the baseline for all scenario calculations instead of entry prices. Additionally, fetch ATR-based volatility data via recent klines (https://fapi.binance.com/fapi/v1/klines) for each position's symbol to dynamically suggest realistic scenario percentages (e.g., '1-day ATR move', '3-day ATR move') as preset buttons alongside the existing presets. Display the current live price used as the simulation baseline for each position in the results panel.

Add a new 'Live Risk Metrics' summary card at the top of the Risk Management tab (frontend/src/components/RiskManagementTab.tsx) that displays real-time aggregate risk data fetched from Binance. For each active position, compute and display: (1) estimated liquidation price using the formula based on leverage, entry price, and maintenance margin rate fetched from https://fapi.binance.com/fapi/v1/leverageBracket; (2) distance to liquidation as a percentage from the current live price; (3) a color-coded liquidation risk badge — green if >20% away, amber if 10–20% away, red if <10% away. Show a portfolio-level summary row aggregating the number of positions at each risk level. Refresh all metrics every 30 seconds.

Remove the PositionEntryForm component from the Dashboard tab (frontend/src/components/DashboardTab.tsx). The form and its associated 'Add Position' UI must no longer be rendered anywhere in the Dashboard tab. The only way to add positions to the dashboard must be via the existing 'Import from Binance' button. Do not remove the PositionEntryForm component file itself — only stop rendering it in DashboardTab.tsx.

new_feature_requests.summary: Manual position entry form with asset, position type, leverage, entry price, and investment amount fields
Validate assets against Binance USD-M Futures pairs only
Real-time position monitoring with current price from Binance API and PnL calculations
AI-powered take-profit recommendations (TP1, TP2, TP3) based on technical analysis
AI-powered stop-loss recommendations considering leverage risk and volatility
Position dashboard with real-time updates and visual indicators
Save positions to localStorage for persistence
Apply golden color theme and add background graphics/charts for a modern tech aesthetic
Convert application to PWA with install button that triggers installation directly from the app interface
Market sentiment analysis based on news and social media data
Trend prediction using machine learning algorithms
Automatic real-time suggestions for TP/SL adjustments based on market conditions
Position size calculator based on percentage risk of capital
Total portfolio exposure visualization showing aggregate risk across all positions
Scenario simulator showing potential outcomes if price moves by specific percentages
Add total capital/portfolio value input that persists and enables automatic real risk calculation across all positions
AI daily trades showcase area: AI executes one demo trade per trading style/modality using real Binance USDT-M Futures perpetual data to demonstrate app accuracy
Organize app into tabs: Dashboard, AI Daily Trades, AI Insights, Risk Management
Auto-regenerate a new AI trade for a modality when its current trade hits TP or SL, without waiting for the daily UTC reset
Use user's portfolio value as the base investment amount for AI daily trades, and add a comparative performance panel showing AI vs user trade accuracy and PnL side by side
When an AI trade hits TP1/TP2/TP3, execute the fictitious order and advance to the next risk management step (e.g., move SL to entry after TP1, trail SL after TP2, etc.)
AI should recognize market reversals and be able to reverse trade direction or close positions early to protect accumulated profits before they erode

Integrate Binance authenticated API for real order execution: allow users to input their API Key and Secret (stored in localStorage), implement HMAC-SHA256 signing, and send real orders to Binance Futures when TP/SL levels are hit
Remove the daily UTC reset for AI trades — trades are only generated on first load and regenerated automatically after TP/SL is hit, with no daily reset
Read and import open positions from Binance Futures account into the app dashboard using authenticated API calls

Add a per-modality live trading toggle switch on each AI Daily Trade card (Scalping, Day Trading, Swing Trading, Trend Following) to individually enable/disable real Binance order execution for that specific modality, independent of the global Live Trading toggle

Update the Risk Management tab to use real asset data from Binance (live prices, volatility, leverage tiers, liquidation prices) for more accurate position size calculations, portfolio exposure, and scenario simulations
Remove the manual position entry form (PositionEntryForm) from the Dashboard, keeping only the 'Import from Binance' button as the way to add positions
